title.narrative: 3.1 EVIDENCE BASED PLANNING AND MONITORING

description.narrative: 3.1 Government has improved institutional capacity for evidence-based policy planning, and monitoring., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more children have improved and meaningful learning outcomes

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.1 Government has improved institutional capacity for evidence-based policy planning, and monitoring.

description.narrative: Towards improved capacity for evidence-based planning in 2021, UNICEF supported the two Education Ministries to develop an evidence-informed and consultative Education Sector Plan (ESP) 2022-2026. UNICEF also supported Government in strengthening the education information management system (EMIS) and ensuring timely and quality data through ongoing trainings to build capacity of government staff at national and district levels. Findings of the out-of-school children (OOSC) study update and SRGBV Action Research informed equity focused education strategies and policy decisions. UNICEF also supported 35,466 OOSC children (32,826 girls; 2,640 boys) through community structures to enroll and stay in school. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
